result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher R Taylor was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
$500.00 cash bond to be applied towards Court costs and the remainder to be returned to whomever posted it.
In the event of non-payment of outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christopher R Taylor

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Christopher R Taylor in court with attorney John Gerard Hinde.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
State relates agreement. Defendant pleads guilty to count 2. Court accepts the plea and finds the Defendant guilty. 
Argument by State. Argument by Defense. 

Court relates and orders: 
Costs 
Must submit DNA sample and pay the surcharge. 
$500.00 cash bond to be applied.   

Order for DNA given to the defendant in court.

$500.00 CASH BOND PREVIOUSLY POSTED.
Defendant shall be fingerprinted at the Barron County Sheriff's Dept., if not already done.
If represented by the Public Defender and does not have a phone, must contact the Public Defender weekly at 715-537-1191.
Must not possess any firearms.

Defendant Christopher R Taylor in court with attorney John Gerard Hinde.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant waives formal reading of Complaint and pleads NG.  Plea hearing scheduled for February 3, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
